title: Are some humans born evil? - Quora

response.answer_text: I agree that evil is a learned construct - however I also agree that some can be born with deficiencies or damage to the areas of the brain that control certain emotions. For example if a 7 year old child decides to set his puppy dog on fire - most people would consider that as evil - but the child might lack the faculty to feel the animal's pain or see the value of the dog vs. the pig that was on the BBQ yesterday. Just to follow that particular line if thought a bit further …… do people think that the people in the Asian countries who eat cats and dogs and other animals considered as domestic animals elsewhere - as evil people? So unless the areas of the brain have a deficiency or is damaged, then a perfectly normal young child can learn the behaviours commonly associated with evil as a construct from - parents - siblings - community - TV - movies - games - books - Internet……. Etc etc etc. Remember normal behaviour is what the majority of people in your - community - state - country etc decide it is and to what extent they'll tolerate deviances from their commonly shared and tolerated construct of normality. So canabilism could become normal if enough people decide it is. Do some reading jn sociology about reality and construct and society's constructed values etc.

Yes, although I would prefer ‘genetically predisposed towards evil’. Most humans have innate filters which prevent anti-social behavior. Why? Because throughout time, until recently, being anti-social was very bad for your survival and for passing on your genes. The rest of the social group would just kill you. You need to contribute to the group or you will be killed. This is why humans are the way they are (social creatures). However, every generation variation produces more people with an anti-social bent. This causes the extreme cases, with a little environmental help, to become the evil people we all know. If they don’t get environmental help (think your evil uncle George) , then they are locally evil and history does not record them. So, very much yes, evil people are born every minute, most of them won’t kill you but they will make you miserable. As soon as you realize it - stay away, you can’t kill them nowadays.

This is a very controversial subject, but I will give you my take on it. Human beings are unpredictable creatures. We scrutinize other human’s actions and gestures starting from the day we are born. We may incline to mimic or avoid these imbibed gestures hence to be or not to be evil. A child may observe unfavorable characteristics in his/her parent’s behavior, and may, most likely reflect these characteristics in his/her own behavior depending on the child’s own sense of morality. “Evil” may also be linked to mental flaws or trauma, or it could be linked to avenge or revenge, thus showing the individual’s capability to commit “evil”. Now, the nature of being “evil” must, without question, have relation to one’s background and/or mental sanity and plainly the sense of good/bad. The view of “evil” may differ by what is considered evil and on what degree the evil is displayed. But what I believe is that nobody is born “evil”, rather grown to be “evil”.

The Bible says we all are born with the sin nature. Teach a baby to be good all you like but shortly the sin nature shows itself, you never have to teach a child to be bad, it is built in. Sins can get worse as a person goes to adulthood. God gives us a way to overcome this. Galations 5:16 "So I say, let the Holy Spirit guide your lives. Then you won’t be doing what your sinful nature craves. 17 The sinful nature wants to do evil, which is just the opposite of what the Spirit wants..........19 When you follow the desires of your sinful nature, the results are very clear: sexual immorality, impurity, lustful pleasures, 20 idolatry, sorcery, hostility, quarreling, jealousy, outbursts of anger, selfish ambition, dissension, division, 21 envy, drunkenness, wild parties, and other sins like these. Let me tell you again, as I have before, that anyone living that sort of life will not inherit the Kingdom of God."

No. Evil is a human construct. Are there humans born with psychological issues that allow them to act in a way that most would define as evil? Yes. There are psychosis that prevent a person from feeling basic empathy. These people are often deemed evil. It is psychological, not being ‘born evil’.

No. All humans are born inclined to evil. Whether we’re actually born evil, born good, or born partly good and partly damaged, in the end it all adds to the same thing. If you’re human and alive, you need to be TAUGHT to be good. You do NOT need to be taught how to lie, kill, steal, etc. This is all due to the fall of man. Only the real God of the Bible has the answer to these questions. Much of human philosophy considers evil to be natural - and therefore negates evil as being evil. Only God tells us the Truth. I pray that you believe on the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and call upon Him for salvation. :) <3

There is a simple way to answer that. Evil is malicious intent. Willingly and deliberately harmful behaviour. What would an evil baby do with malicious intent? Play with its toes? Giggle? Burp? I know they can produce evil smells. But I don’t know if it is with intent. If anything, they seem happy to share.

Humans are born wild , then become domesticated and learned through training . If a child is not taught proper behavior they will not know how to behave. If a child is not raised with love and patience they will act out . Bad behavior is a learned behavior.

Yes, for sure in the state of nature. Thomas Hobbes thought that we were bad in the state of nature, whereas Rousseau thought the completely opposite. I tend to agree with Hobbes on this matter given that we're all born with an instinct of self-preservation, which implies some negative attitudes and actions towards accomplishing it.
